Job Description Role Objective: Business Analyst at Propel is a key player bridging the channel between clients, end users and delivery team. The primary objective of a Business Analyst is to understand the client requirement and business logic. The Business Analyst is also responsible to ensure that the solution meets the client’s business needs, quality, and other compliance requirements throughout the delivery cycle  Responsibilities: Client Relationship Management & Consulting: Collaborates with the client’s business, and tech team to understand, analyse, and prioritise the functional business requirements. Prepares and presents proposals and recommendations to key stakeholders by analysing the project scope and requirements. Generate opportunities on improvements to achieve the desired business results which are in line with the business requirements. Works closely with clients, C-suite, and leadership team (internal & external) in conducting for research, gathering & structuring data, deriving insights and recommend solutions. Understands data and provides meaningful insights that adds value to business process. Works closely with both business and technology teams while learning & building the required expertise/vocabulary to bridge the gaps. Solution Design & Delivery Management: Works closely with clients to gather requirements, define scope and arrive at the solution plan. Writes scope proposals, business requirement document, software requirement document as aligned to client requirements, schedules, and budgets. Accountable for the maintenance and delivery of all business and technical documents as per the client needs and Propel standards. Supports Consulting Directors and Delivery Leads in planning the execution phase of a solution which includes team resource planning, effort planning, timeline, and other estimations. Works closely with Creative Director and UX teams for solution prototypes and wireframe designs. Supports and shadows Architects and Delivery Leads in designing the solution architecture. Supervises entire SDLC software analysis, design, development, unit testing and system integration and facilitates towards building reliable and viable solutions.  Team Management: Shadows Consulting Directors or Delivery Leads in arriving at effort estimation. Manages project budget by supervising the estimated effort vs actual effort. Involves in developing technical skills and application knowledge within the team to enhance core competencies/execute cross training/implement succession plan and ensure adherence to change management process. Engages in validating, monitoring, analysing the request, defining the standards, generating the opportunities & evaluating and agreeing on improvements with the concerned teams to achieve the desired business results. Nurtures Propel way by actively participating in initiatives and contributing to build psychological safety where the team prioritises fixing the process rather than trying to ‘fix’ the person involved. Understands the importance of teamwork, enables, and empowers self & fellow team members by identifying training/coaching opportunities or needs.  Requirement: Excellent Communication Skills, Good Logical Comprehension, Problem Solving Ability, Drive for Results, Leadership Skills, Sound understanding of Microsoft office tools like Excel, PPT, Word. Knowledge of the common application/web security and OWASP vulnerabilities.  Values: Legacy is a bad word in technology, standing still is the same as being outdated. With growing latest trends and digital transformation, we believe in continuously upgrading our skills based on the market needs. Following is Propel’s brand fundamentals, and we look for people who share similar values. Description: ABOUT US We are an innovative Edtech company on a mission to revolutionize learning by blending cutting-edge technology with engaging educational experiences. Our goal is to empower learners across the globe with tools that inspire curiosity, growth, and success. THE ROLE We are seeking a Data Analytics Trainer to deliver comprehensive and hands-on training programs to students and professionals. The ideal candidate should have strong expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, data visualization, and tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, R, and Power BI/Tableau. You will be responsible for designing curriculum, conducting interactive sessions, and ensuring learners gain practical, industry-relevant skills. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct interactive and practical training sessions on, o Data analysis fundamentals (data cleaning, wrangling, and pre-processing) o Statistical concepts (mean, median, standard deviation, correlation, etc.) o Data visualization using Power BI, Tableau, and Excel o Programming languages: Python (Pandas, NumPy), R, and SQL o Data modeling and predictive analytics Create and update training materials, presentations, and course content. Design practical assignments, projects, and case studies to enhance learning outcomes. Ensure course content aligns with industry trends and best practices. Conduct live demos on data extraction, cleaning, and visualization. Guide students in building and optimizing their own data analytical projects. Evaluate participants' performance through tests, assignments, and projects. Provide constructive feedback and support learners in skill improvement. Stay updated with the latest data analytics tools, trends, and technologies. Guide students on career paths, certifications, and interview preparation. WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Proven experience as a Data Analyst, Data scientist or Trainer. Strong expertise in Excel and SQL, Python/R, Power BI,Tableau. Knowledge of machine learning basics is a plus. Ability to simplify complex topics for learners at different skill levels. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. WHY JOIN US? Impactful Work: Be part of a company that’s transforming education and making a global impact. Growth Opportunities: Take on a pivotal role in a growing company with the chance to shape the future of the business. Dynamic Culture: Join a passionate and collaborative team where your ideas will be valued and your voice heard. Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of a flexible work environment, with options for remote or hybrid arrangements. Compensation: Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses, and benefits. HOW TO APPLY If you are passionate about helping students shape their future and meet the above criteria, we would love to hear from you! Submit your application with your resume at hrvinsup@gmail.com . Join us to make a difference in the lives of students and help them achieve their dreams! Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Preferred Certifications: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Certification Tableau Desktop Specialist/Certified Associate AWS certified data analytics Google data analytics professional certificate Python/SQL related certifications Experience: 1+ year of hands-on experience in Data Analytics. 1+ year of training experience preferred. Overview: The person will be will be playing an active role as part of the Global - Europe Business Intelligence Center of Excellence. The person should have very strong Business Intelligence skills and will play a critical role in executing key transformations of Global PPD. Driving simplification, standardization and self service capabilities agenda along with enhancing the platform by driving key initiatives that will further drive the adoption of the platform. The person should be able to translate the business requirements into accurate IT/platform development plans and will manage platform development accordingly. Expect some strong data manipulation on excel, Tableau &/or PowerBI and heavy usage of Nielsen Retail Panel and Kantar/GFK/Ipsos Household Panel Responsibilities: Own and be accountable for the continuous PPD transformation and development efforts: Design reporting and business intelligence products including visualizations & self-service tools. Manage project delivery, including estimating timelines and identifying risks Collaborate with stakeholders to get clarity on development briefs Proceed with the platform development alongside and in collaboration with the Global BI GBS Team Present products to business users and seek feedback for continued improvement Make data meaningful using advanced visualization techniques to provide actionable insights and intuitive dashboards to a broad spectrum of stakeholders to accelerate decision making. Develop quick designs for data visualization and work iteratively to make them deliver the data and insights useful for data driven decisions Expand PPD beyond Nielsen Retail Panel source with more multi-sources reports to drive more holistic and 360° performances reviews and assessments Maintain documentation and user guides for created products Follow the formal processes for Incidents, Change Requests, Deployments and Service Requests Troubleshoot complex issues and provide root cause analysis and recommendations for permanent solutions Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality. Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems. Ensure the processes are documented. Work in an agile environment with the scrum team, participating actively in daily scrum and sprint planning to service the needs of the Business teams by delivering solutions. Maintain strong collaboration & relationship across the board - Global BI Development team, Business teams, IT, Data Modeling and Architecture teams Qualifications: Tech/B.E./MCA from reputed institutes 2+ years of experience with Analytics and developing BI solutions – Expertise in Tableau and/or PowerBI Knowledge on “Point of Sale” (Nielsen/IRI/Kantar/Global Data) databases/metrics a must Experience in User-centered design, wireframing, knowledge of the data visualization concepts, Development of visualizations and interactivity depending on the context and overall focus on aesthetics Structured thinker / problem solver who works independently with attention to detail Excellent communication & presentation skills (verbal & written) is mandatory. Confident communicator, able to express ideas and convey complicated concepts simply Experience working in an Agile team Must be detail oriented with excellent organizational/time management skills

Job Title: Senior Power BI Developer (6–8 Years Experience)
Description: Job Description: We’re looking for a skilled and experienced Power BI Developer with 6–8 years of hands-on expertise in building enterprise-grade dashboards, data models, and reporting systems. As part of our growing team at Aptocoiner Analytics, you'll work with leading global clients across industries to deliver impactful business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Fabric. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain complex Power BI dashboards and data models Integrate data from various sources including SQL, Excel, SAP, and APIs Implement Row-Level Security and scheduled data refresh Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business requirements Optimize DAX queries and dataflows for performance Work closely with Fabric architects and cloud engineers Key Skills: Strong Power BI development and visualization skills Proficiency in DAX, Power Query, and SQL Experience with Microsoft Fabric is a plus Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL pipelines Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Nice to Have: Experience with Azure Synapse, Data Factory, or other Microsoft cloud services Industry exposure in healthcare, logistics, retail, or finance Why Join Us: Work with a Microsoft Partner on cutting-edge data projects Opportunity to grow with a fast-scaling analytics firm Supportive team, flexible work environment, and career progression Job Type: Full-time Pay: ₹393,916.97 - ₹1,602,233.17 per year Work Location: In person
